item.description:
lease join us for our recording event in Porter square. We will be working with "Learning Ally" recording books for the blind and those with reading disabilities.

http://www.learningally.org/.

 

2067 Massachusetts Avenue, 3rd Floor,

Cambridge, MA (Henderson-Carriage Building)

 

T Stop :Porter square T stop on the red line. After exiting out of the T stop, walk right for a couple of blocks on Mass. Ave till you reach 2067 Mass Avenue(Big Red building).

Parking :There is plenty of free parking behind the studio. Access from Hadley Street. Please use the unmarked parking spots at the back of the parking lot or lots marked RBFD.

We will work between 5.30 and 8.30 which will include training. A certain degree of comfort in reading is required, but a mild accent is acceptable, as long as your reading would be discernible to an average listener. We usually work in groups of 2 or 3, taking turns to record and listen. The final product is an audio book which Learning Ally loans out to those who are blind or may have other reading disabilities. This is a great way to reach out with an activity which endures for a while.

 

Look forward to volunteering with you.

Nagina

 

The Boston Volunteers

Big enough to deliver, small enough to care

Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org


Learn more about your fellow Boston Volunteers:

P.S. Please friend popular Paulette.

Who is Paulette: http://www.facebook.com/paulette.revere.7

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Record Books for the Blind and the Dyslexic
